holidays.name: Global Running Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate the joy of running and encourage people around the world to get moving, whether you're a seasoned marathoner or a casual jogger.
holidays.origin: Initiated by the New York Road Runners in 2009 to promote fitness and community through running.
holidays.funFact: On Global Running Day, people participate in runs from tiny backyard sprints to massive urban marathons, illustrating how universal running truly is.

holidays.name: VCR Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to celebrating the trusty Video Cassette Recorder, the iconic technology that changed the way people watched movies at home.
holidays.origin: Established by the Museum of Obsolete Media to honor the VCR‚Äôs impact since its popularization in the late 1970s.
holidays.funFact: At its peak, VCRs were in nearly 90% of American homes, but now they're largely obsolete, making this day a trip down memory lane.

holidays.name: National Chocolate Ice Cream Day
holidays.description: A delicious day to indulge in one of the most popular and beloved ice cream flavors‚Äîchocolate!
holidays.origin: Unofficial food holiday celebrated in the United States to honor chocolate ice cream's creamy goodness.
holidays.funFact: Chocolate ice cream ranks consistently among the top three flavors in the world alongside vanilla and strawberry.

holidays.name: Apple Strudel Day
holidays.description: A quirky celebration of the classic flaky and sweet apple-filled pastry that originated in Austria but is enjoyed worldwide.
holidays.origin: An unofficial day created by pastry enthusiasts to honor the beloved dessert on this date.
holidays.funFact: The layers of dough in a traditional apple strudel are so thin they can almost read a newspaper through them!
